docs.title: Homelab Data Platform
docs.text: Welcome to the homelab data platform documentation.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This homelab runs a complete data platform on Kubernetes, managed with GitOps principles using Flux.

docs.title: Key Components
docs.text:
• Infrastructure: Kubernetes cluster with Flux CD for GitOps
  • Storage: Rook/Ceph for distributed storage
  • Data Platform: Catalog, orchestration, and processing tools
  • Applications: VS Code Server, Keycloak, and more
  • Monitoring: Observability stack for the entire platform

docs.title: System Design
docs.text: This homelab implements a modern data platform on Kubernetes with the following layers:

docs.title: Infrastructure Layer
docs.text:
• Kubernetes cluster
  • Flux CD for GitOps
  • Rook/Ceph for storage
  • Networking and ingress

docs.title: Data Layer
docs.text:
• Object storage (lakehouse)
  • Databases
  • Data catalog
  • Processing engines

docs.title: Application Layer
docs.text:
• Development tools (VS Code Server)
  • Authentication (Keycloak)
  • User applications

docs.title: Observability Layer
docs.text:
• Metrics collection
  • Logging
  • Alerting

docs.title: Design Principles
docs.text:
• GitOps: All configuration in Git
  • Declarative: Infrastructure as code
  • Scalable: Designed to grow
  • Observable: Full visibility into system state

docs.title: Deploying a New Application
docs.text:
1. Create manifests in apps/base/<app-name>/
  2. Create kustomization overlay in apps/staging/<app-name>/
  3. Reference in clusters/staging/apps.yaml
  4. Commit and push - Flux will deploy

docs.title: Updating an Application
docs.text:
1. Update the manifest or kustomization
  2. Commit and push
  3. Monitor with flux get kustomizations

docs.title: Checking Flux Status
docs.text:
flux get kustomizations
flux get helmreleases
flux logs

docs.title: Accessing Logs
docs.text: kubectl logs -n <namespace> <pod-name>

docs.title: Flux Not Syncing
docs.text:
Check Flux status and logs: 

flux get sources git
flux logs

docs.title: Pod Not Starting
docs.text:
Check pod status and events: 

kubectl describe pod <pod-name> -n <namespace>
kubectl logs <pod-name> -n <namespace>

docs.title: Storage Issues
docs.text:
Check Rook/Ceph status: 

kubectl get cephcluster -n rook-ceph
kubectl get cephblockpool -n rook-ceph

docs.title: Network Issues
docs.text:
Check ingress and services: 

kubectl get ingress -A
kubectl get svc -A
